title: Shopify's Storefront Renderer: Rails at Scale
summary: How Shopify reengineered their storefront rendering to handle Flash Sales and viral traffic spikes.
content:
Case Study: Shopify Storefront Renderer

Shopify's merchant storefronts must handle extraordinary traffic spikes — a single Flash Sale can send millions of requests in seconds. Shopify rebuilt their storefront rendering infrastructure to handle this reliably.

Engineering Challenges

Ruby on Rails, Shopify's original framework, struggled at extreme scale. Shopify built a new Storefront Renderer in a way that separates rendering concerns from business logic, using aggressive caching and worker pools.

Results

The new infrastructure handles millions of requests per second with sub-100ms response times. Merchants can now sell during viral moments without worrying about downtime.

Key Learnings

Caching is the single most impactful performance optimisation. Separate reads from writes. Design your system for the peak load, not the average.
